alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 5:49PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF NAVAJO NATION ... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated up to 1 inch of rain has fallen due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cold Spring Wash, Black Soil Wash, Red Clay Wash, Fish Wash, Tse Bonito Wash, Beshbito Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Sage House Wash, Scattered Willow Wash, Oak Ridge Wash, Bis Ii Ah Wash, Big Dam Wash, Kinlichee Creek, Black Creek, Bonito Creek, West Fork Black Creek, Whitewater Arroyo, Meadow Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Burntwater Wash, Puerco River, Cienega Creek, Steamboat Wash, Nazlini Wash, Bent Knee Wash, Lone Tule Wash, Piney Hill Creek, Ruin Wash, Thsohotso Wash and Burnt Piqon Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kinlichee Chapter House, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Klagetoh, Burnside, Wide Ruins, Cornfields Chapter House, Nazlini, Pine Springs, Sunrise Springs, Oak Springs Valley, Window Rock, Steamboat, Steamboat Canyon, Houck, Toyei, Ganado, St. Michaels, Navajo Reservation and Hopi Reservation. - This includes the following highways... Highway 191 between mile markers 392 and 438. Interstate 40 between mile markers 346 and 359. State Route 264 between mile markers 420 and 475. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
